alert.note: Alert for Texas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 30 at 9:29PM CDT until March 31 at 1:13PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in south central Missouri, Dent, Howell, Oregon, Shannon and Texas. In southwest Missouri, Douglas and Ozark. * WHEN...Until 930 AM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 929 PM CDT, The Department of Transportation and river gauge readings reported that flooding from previous heavy rain continues in the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen across the area. Even though the heavy rain has ending residual flooding will continue through the overnight hours. Flood prone areas including low water crossings will be the most susceptible to flooding overnight. - This includes the following low water crossings... Lick Creek at County Road 528, Mahans Creek at County Road 501, Warm Fork Spring River at County Road 323, Howell Creek at County Road 9790 and Gladden Creek at County Road 624. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Plains, Salem, Mountain View, Thayer, Willow Springs, Houston, Licking and Cabool. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
